page.title: 18The Churches, Bryanston
page.content: {St Martin's Church}is on the site of the Wyatt designed house. It was built at the turn of the century in part to serve the village and the new house. It was bought by the School after it became a "redundant" church in the mid 70s. It is now used by the School for Sunday services which are optional for pupils. There are several memorials in the Church which is now dominated by a recently added organ in the crossing. Recitals are given regularly. Next to St Martin's, below the old stable block, is{the 18th c. Chapel. } This is still owned by the Portmans, and contains the family vault. It is rarely used but is regularly heated. In the School,{St Anthony's Chapel is in the basement, converted from the wine cellars.The Chaplain & Assistant, a Deaconess,teach as well as minister in the non_denominational School.
